content.title: Amputation in Buerger Disease
content.description: Outcomes and prevention of amputation in thromboangiitis obliterans

key_concepts.details: Major amputation rate 10-25% at 5 years in continued smokers
Complete abstinence from all tobacco products is the only proven intervention to prevent amputation
Often requires multiple minor amputations; attempt tissue-sparing levels
Distal small vessel involvement often precludes bypass; limited revascularization options

content.clinical_significance: Smoking cessation can reduce amputation rate to near zero

primary_sources: Olin JW. N Engl J Med 2000
